g.text: Synthesis, Crystal Structure, and Photoluminescence Characteristics
College of Physics and Optoelectronics, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan 030024, P. R. China
Institute for Advanced Study, Shenzhen University, Nanhai Avenue 3688, Shenzhen 518060, P. R. China
In this article, a series of novel Mn
synthesized via a high-temperature solid-state method. The
crystal structure, morphology, and luminescent performance
of the samples were investigated in detail with X-ray
diﬀraction, ﬁeld emission scanning electron microscopy,
photoluminescence (PL) spectra, decay curves, and internal
quantum eﬃciency (IQE). Excited at 358 nm, these samples
showed an intense deep-red emission band peaking at 688 nm
spectra of these samples monitored at 688 nm exhibited two
broad excitation bands from 250 to 600 nm with peaks at 358 and 469 nm. The systematic investigation of the concentration-
phosphors revealed that the deep-red emission intensity reached the maximum when
doping concentration was 0.6 mol %. The critical distance (
36.57 Å, and the major mechanism of energy transfer among Mn
decay lifetimes decreased from 0.285 to 0.248 ms with the increasing Mn
doping concentration from 0.2 to 1.2 mol %. The
clairage coordinates of the optimal BGT:0.6%Mn
of the IQE for all BGT:Mn
samples were measured, and the highest value could reach up to 62%. The above results revealed
deep-red-emitting phosphors had promising potential for application in indoor plant
It is well known that light is the basic factor of plant growth
Light can not only provide the energy
needed for plant photosynthesis but also regulate plant life
activities, such as seed germination, seedling formation,
illumination technology is an indispensable part of modern
agricultural development; especially for areas lacking land
resources and light conditions, plant illumination is particularly
As reported previously, the blue light around 450
500 nm) and red light around 660 nm (610
nm) are important for photosynthesis, phototropism, and
(LEDs) possess many advantages, such as energy savings, low
cost, high eﬃciency, environmental friendliness, and long
lifetimes, and could be considered as the main type of light
source for both general lighting and plant growth lighting.
According to the current situation, searching for phosphors
with bright red emission for plant growth lighting is imperative.
could serve as eﬃcient luminescent activators with a strong
emission covering the region from 600 to 800 nm, were widely
investigated for developing new red phosphors.
ions can be stable in the host matrix with

(BGT) double perovskite have not been reported until now.

using the conventional high-temperature solid-state reaction

discussed. Our results demonstrated that the as-prepared
